title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Mushrooms
description: Savory portobello mushrooms stuffed with a creamy spinach and feta filling, baked to perfection.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove stems from mushrooms and gently scrape out gills with a spoon to create space for filling.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add spinach and cook until wilted, then remove from heat.
Mix spinach with feta cheese, breadcrumbs, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Fill each mushroom cap with the mixture and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until mushrooms are tender and filling is golden.
Serve warm as an appetizer or side dish.

title: Coconut Curry Lentil Soup
description: A warming, protein-rich soup with red lentils, coconut milk, and aromatic spices.
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onions and carrots, sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in curry powder and turmeric, cook for 30 seconds.
Add lentils and vegetable broth, bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes until lentils are tender.
Stir in coconut milk and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and lime wedges.

title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
description: A refreshing and protein-packed salad with quinoa, fresh vegetables, and a zesty lemon dressing.
ingredients: 1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
steps: Cook quinoa in water according to package instructions, then let cool.
In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, olives, feta, red onion, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to let flavors meld.
Serve chilled as a main dish or side salad.

title: Roasted Vegetable Lasagna
description: Layers of pasta, roasted vegetables, rich tomato sauce, and creamy ricotta create this hearty vegetarian lasagna.
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss sliced vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on baking sheets.
Roast vegetables for 20-25 minutes until tender and slightly caramelized.
Reduce oven temperature to 375°F (190°C).
Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions, then drain.
In a bowl, mix ricotta, egg, half the mozzarella, 1/4 cup Parmesan, basil, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Spread 1/2 cup marinara sauce in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer noodles, ricotta mixture, roasted vegetables, and sauce; repeat layers.
Top with remaining noodles, sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan.
Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 15 more minutes until bubbly and golden.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Black Bean and Sweet Potato Tacos
description: Hearty tacos filled with spiced black beans, roasted sweet potatoes, and fresh toppings.
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potato with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on baking sheet.
Roast sweet potatoes for 25-30 minutes until tender and slightly caramelized.
In a pan, sauté red onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, chili powder, and smoked paprika. Cook for 1 minute.
Add black beans and cook until heated through. Gently mash some beans.
Warm tortillas according to package instructions.
Assemble tacos with sweet potatoes, black bean mixture, avocado slices, salsa, and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Creamy Italian rice dish with sautéed mushrooms, white wine, and Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 1 lb mixed mushrooms (cremini, shiitake, oyster), sliced
steps: In a large pan, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and sauté mushrooms until golden. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, heat remaining olive oil and add onion. Cook until translucent.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add Arborio rice and stir to coat with oil, cooking for 1-2 minutes.
Pour in white wine and stir until absorbed.
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring frequently until absorbed before adding more.
Continue this process for about 18-20 minutes until rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in mushrooms, butter, Parmesan, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Remove from heat and let rest for 2 minutes.
Serve garnished with fresh parsley and additional Parmesan.

title: Thai Red Curry with Tofu
description: Spicy and aromatic Thai curry with tofu, vegetables, and coconut milk served over steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 block (14 oz) firm tofu, pressed and cubed
steps: Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add tofu cubes and cook until golden on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté garlic and ginger for 1 minute.
Add curry paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add eggplant and cook for 5 minutes.
Add bell pepper and broccoli, simmer for 3-4 minutes.
Stir in snow peas, soy sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice.
Return tofu to the pan and simmer for 2 more minutes.
Garnish with Thai basil leaves and serve over steamed jasmine rice.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
description: Classic Italian dish with breaded eggplant slices, marinara sauce, and melted cheese.
ingredients: 2 large eggplants, sliced into 1/4 inch rounds
steps: Sprinkle eggplant slices with salt and let sit for 30 minutes to release moisture. Pat dry.
Mix breadcrumbs with 1/2 cup Parmesan, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Dredge eggplant slices in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumb mixture.
Heat olive oil in a large pan and fry eggplant slices until golden brown on both sides.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a baking dish, spread 1/2 cup marinara sauce on the bottom.
Layer eggplant slices, marinara sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan. Repeat layers.
Finish with a layer of sauce and remaining cheese.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Let rest for 10 minutes, garnish with fresh basil before serving.

title: Vegetable Pad Thai
description: Thai stir-fried rice noodles with tofu, vegetables, and a tangy-sweet sauce topped with crushed peanuts.
ingredients: 7 oz firm tofu, pressed and cubed
steps: Soak rice noodles in hot water according to package instructions until al dente, then drain.
Mix sauce ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large wok or pan over high heat.
Add tofu and cook until golden, remove and set aside.
Add another tablespoon of oil and scramble eggs if using. Remove and set aside.
Heat remaining oil and stir-fry garlic for 30 seconds.
Add carrots and bell pepper, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add drained noodles and sauce. Toss to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add tofu, scrambled eggs, bean sprouts, and half the green onions. Toss for 1 minute.
Serve topped with crushed peanuts, remaining green onions, cilantro, and lime wedges.

title: Butternut Squash Soup
description: Velvety soup made with roasted butternut squash, aromatic spices, and a touch of cream.
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
1/2 cup heavy cream (or coconut milk for vegan version)
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss butternut squash with 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on baking sheet.
Roast squash for 25-30 minutes until tender and caramelized.
In a large pot, heat remaining olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and carrots, sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and apple, cook for 2 minutes.
Add roasted squash, vegetable broth, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to purée the soup until smooth.
Stir in cream and warm through. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with roasted pumpkin seeds.

title: Cauliflower Buffalo Wings
description: Crispy baked cauliflower florets coated in spicy buffalo sauce for a vegetarian take on buffalo wings.
ingredients: 1 large head cauliflower, cut into florets
1 tablespoon honey (or maple syrup for vegan version)
Ranch or blue cheese dressing for dipping
steps: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, milk, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Dip cauliflower florets in batter until fully coated, letting excess drip off.
Place on prepared baking sheet, leaving space between florets.
Bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden and crispy.
Meanwhile, mix hot sauce, melted butter, and honey in a bowl.
Remove cauliflower from oven and brush generously with buffalo sauce mixture.
Return to oven for 10 more minutes until sauce is set and edges are crispy.
Serve hot with ranch or blue cheese dressing and celery sticks.

title: Vegetable Biryani
description: Aromatic Indian rice dish layered with spiced vegetables, herbs, and fragrant basmati rice.
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes
2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, green beans, potatoes), chopped
steps: Drain soaked rice. In a large pot, bring water or broth to a boil with 1 teaspoon salt.
Add rice and cook until 70% done, about 5-6 minutes. Drain and set aside.
In another pot, heat ghee or oil. Add cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, bay leaf, and cumin seeds.
Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft. Stir in yogurt and garam masala.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer half the rice, then the vegetable mixture, then remaining rice.
Sprinkle with mint, cilantro, and fried onions.
Cover tightly with foil and lid. Cook on low heat for 20 minutes.
Let rest for 10 minutes before opening. Gently mix layers when serving.

title: Caprese Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
description: Portobello mushrooms filled with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Clean mushrooms and remove gills with a spoon.
Brush mushrooms with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes to soften.
Remove from oven and fill each mushroom with minced garlic.
Top with mozzarella slices and cherry tomatoes.
Sprinkle with Italian seasoning.
Return to oven and bake for 15 minutes until cheese is melted.
Garnish with fresh basil and drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.

title: Vegetable Enchiladas
description: Corn tortillas filled with roasted vegetables and beans, topped with enchilada sauce and melted cheese.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss zucchini, bell peppers, onion, and corn with olive oil, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes until tender.
Reduce oven temperature to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine roasted vegetables with black beans.
Spread 1/2 cup enchilada sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Warm tortillas briefly to make them pliable.
Fill each tortilla with vegetable mixture and a sprinkle of cheese.
Roll up and place seam-side down in the baking dish.
Pour remaining enchilada sauce over tortillas and top with remaining cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbly.
Serve topped with fresh cilantro, avocado slices, and sour cream.

title: Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie
description: Hearty lentil and vegetable filling topped with creamy mashed potatoes and baked until golden.
ingredients: 2 cups brown or green lentils, cooked
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Boil potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain potatoes and return to pot. Add milk, butter, salt, and pepper. Mash until smooth.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, and celery. Sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add cooked lentils, peas, vegetable broth, soy sauce, thyme, and rosemary.
Simmer for 10 minutes until slightly thickened.
Transfer lentil mixture to a baking dish and spread mashed potatoes on top.
Use a fork to create texture on the potato surface.
Sprinkle with cheese if using.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until top is golden and filling is bubbly.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Vegetable Sushi Rolls
description: Colorful sushi rolls filled with fresh vegetables and creamy avocado.
ingredients: Wasabi and pickled ginger for serving
steps: Rinse sushi rice until water runs clear. Cook with water according to package instructions.
Mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Heat gently until sugar dissolves.
Transfer cooked rice to a wide bowl and pour vinegar mixture over it. Fold gently to combine. Let cool.
Place a nori sheet on a bamboo sushi mat, shiny side down.
Spread a thin layer of rice over 3/4 of the nori, leaving the top quarter empty.
Arrange vegetable strips and avocado in a line across the middle of the rice.
Using the bamboo mat, roll the nori tightly away from you, applying gentle pressure.
Seal the edge with a few drops of water.
Use a sharp, wet knife to cut roll into 6-8 pieces.
Repeat with remaining ingredients.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
